The use of empirical probability density functions shows that the models have good skills in simulating the latitudinal variation of the observable sea-ice drivers ( Fig. 1), although it shows the occurrence of first-year ice above 84째N in 12 of the 18 models, which is not seen in the satellite distribution. Another bias that was not previously reported, e.g., by Notz (
33 ), is the underestimation of the areal extent above 70째N ( Fig. 2D). This is due to the large variation in the area of first-year ice between 70째N and 80째N, which causes this latitudinal band to be characterized by the largest increase of seasonal sea-ice extent by the end of the century ( Fig. 2D).
